Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Supra-Annular and Intra-Annular Aortic Valve Replacement

Participants.evidence: involving 113 patients over 18 years who underwent isolated AVR between March 2013 and June 2019

Intervention.evidence: Patients were divided into supra-annular (n=59) and intra-annular (n=54) groups

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the early outcomes of supra-annular versus intra-annular aortic valve replacement (AVR)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the difference in postoperative complications and echocardiographic findings at one month

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the study's retrospective nature

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the study's retrospective nature

Number_Randomised.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the study's retrospective nature

Number_Analysed.evidence: Patients were divided into supra-annular (n=59) and intra-annular (n=54) groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: The supra-annular group had significantly longer cross-clamp (74.44±15.71 min) and cardiopulmonary bypass times (106.98±22.06 min) compared to the intra-annular group (48.31±13.21 min and 76.63±23.41 min, respectively; p<0.001)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups

Trial_Registration.evidence: No trial registration or funding information was provided

Funding.evidence: No trial registration or funding information was provided
